meanings.sent1: She replanned her birthday party to include more games.
meanings.sent2: After realizing they forgot the snacks, they replanned the picnic.
meanings.sent3: He replanned his route to avoid the barking dog.
meanings.sent4: The team replanned their strategy after the opponent's unexpected move.
meanings.sent5: The student replanned her study schedule to focus on difficult subjects first.

meanings.sent1: They replanned their vacation to visit the beach instead of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The teacher replanned the lesson to include more interactive activities.
meanings.sent3: He replanned his outfit for the party to impress his crush.
meanings.sent4: The chef replanned the menu to accommodate the dietary restrictions of the guests.
meanings.sent5: She replanned her garden layout to maximize sunlight for the plants.

meanings.definition: To reconsider and change a previous plan
meanings.sent1: The manager replanned the project timeline after receiving new information.
meanings.sent2: They replanned the meeting agenda to address urgent issues first.
meanings.sent3: He replanned his morning routine to fit in a quick workout.
meanings.sent4: The couple replanned their wedding ceremony to include a surprise dance.
meanings.sent5: She replanned her budget after unexpected expenses arose.
